tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE weather_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  date DATE,
  temperature FLOAT,
  humidity FLOAT,
  precipitation FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE location_data (
  location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location_name VARCHAR(255),
  zipcode INT,
  latitude FLOAT,
  longitude FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE location (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    city VARCHAR(50),
    country VARCHAR(50),
    latitude FLOAT,
    longitude FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location_id INT,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES location(location_id)
);

CREATE TABLE alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    alert_message VARCHAR(255),
    alert_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensor_data(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WeatherData (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    wind_speed FLOAT,
    rainfall FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE Location (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    city VARCHAR(50),
    country VARCHAR(50),
    latitude FLOAT,
    longitude FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE Sensor (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    installation_date DATE,
    location_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (location_id) REFERENCES Location(location_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Reading (
    reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    wind_speed FLOAT,
    rainfall FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES Sensor(sensor_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    reading_id INT,
    alert_type VARCHAR(50),
    alert_message TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (reading_id) REFERENCES Reading(reading_id)
)
